answers.text: Four Wangs and the individualists Bada Shanren (1626–1705) and Shitao (1641–1707)

qas.question: What two schools of art were created in the 19th century?

answers.text: Shanghai School and the Lingnan School

qas.question: Name two arts of the Four Arts?

context: Yet the most impressive aesthetic works were done among the scholars and urban elite. <a2_0>Calligraphy and painting<a2_0/> remained a central interest to both court painters and scholar-gentry who considered the Four Arts part of their cultural identity and social standing. The painting of the early years of the dynasty included such painters as the orthodox <a0_0>Four Wangs and the individualists Bada Shanren (1626–1705) and Shitao (1641–1707)<a0_0/>. The nineteenth century saw such innovations as the <a1_0>Shanghai School and the Lingnan School<a1_0/> which used the technical skills of tradition to set the stage for modern painting.
